document.heading: Child Abuse and Neglect Prevention Children’s Trust Fund Act of 1993

history.narrative: Law 10-56, the “Child Abuse and Neglect Prevention Children’s Trust Fund Act of 1993,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 10-114, which was referred to the Committee on Human Services. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on July 13, 1993 and September 21, 1993, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on October 1, 1993, it was assigned Act No. 10-109 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 10-56 became effective on November 20, 1993.
